intro: Sida wendtii, commonly known as Wendt's mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, pale pink to white flowers. Sida wendtii is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its fibrous stems and hairy leaves are characteristic of the genus Sida.
